WorkItem.Description:
This issue seems to affect Chrome only as I could not repro on IE11.
Chrome Version 33.0.1750.117 m

When using the zoom feature in Chrome, a portion of the next star becomes visible.  For example, a 5 star configuration zoomed at 110% will show the left portion of a sixth star.

This can be seen on the [samples page](http://www.radioactivethinking.com/rateit/example/example.htm).
WorkItem.Summary: CSS clipping issue when Chrome is zoomed

Comments.Message: That's an annoying bug. I will have a look into it.
Any luck on this issue? Thanks.
No, I haven't. But feel free to fork and send me a pull request.

I shall try to give it a shot. but it seems really tricky :)
It is quite strange though that it only occurs on chrome and not other browsers.
